description.narrative:
Transparencia por Colombia (det lokala kapitlet av Transparency International) har ansökt hos Sida om finansiering på 18,7 miljoner SEK för att genomföra projektet ”För en mer ansvarsfull och transparent maktutövning” i Colombia under perioden augusti 2021 till juli 2025.
Insatsen syftar till att förbättra kontrollen över den offentliga förvaltningen för att göra den mer transparent, ansvarsfull och orienterad mot fredsbyggande och det allmännas bästa genom att 1) ??förespråka ökad öppenhet, ansvar och jämlikhet i tillgången till offentlig förvaltning; 2) följa upp den kontroll som utövas av rättsväsendet och oberoende kontrollorgan över den offentliga förvaltningen i korruptionsärenden; 3) främja medborgarnas tillgång till det offentliga rummet och förespråka effektivare skyddsmekanismer för visselblåsare, särskilt de som är relaterade till kränkningar av de mänskliga rättigheterna, och 4) stärka öppenheten och ansvarsskyldigheten vid genomförandet av fredsavtalet.
Insatsens totala budget är 18,7 miljoner kronor. Cirka 4,5 miljoner SEK av budgeten kommer att vidareförmedlas från Transparencia por Colombia till lokala civilsamhällsorganisationer.

Transparencia por Colombia (the recognized local chapter of Transparency International) has applied to Sida for funding of 18,7 million SEK to carry out the project “Towards a more responsible and transparent exercise of power” in Colombia, during the period August 2021 to July 2025.
The intervention aims at improving control over public administration to make it more transparent, responsible and oriented towards peace-building and the common good, by 1) advocating for increased transparency, responsibility and equality in the access to public administration; 2) monitoring the control exerted by the judicial system and independent control bodies over the public administration in corruption cases; 3) fostering the appropriation of the public sphere by the citizenry and advocate for more effective protection mechanisms for whistle-blowers, in particular those related to human rights’ violations, and 4) strengthening transparency and accountability in the implementation of the Peace Agreement.
The intervention’s total budget is 18,7 million SEK. Approximately 4.5 million SEK of the intervention budget will be forwarded from Transparencia por Colombia to local civil society organizations.

description.narrative:
Some initial activities implemented by the partner that have been informally reported are:
- Identification of seven local partners that receive funds from the project and contribute to implement processes of monitoring, controlling, and sanctioning in relation to electoral financing at the national and local levels in the 2022 elections. Partners selected by TpC are: Fundación Foro Costa Atlántica, Fundación Cívico Social Pro-Cartagena, Unidad de Acción Vallecaucana, Corporación Vigía Cívica, Corporación Cívica de Caldas, Corporación Desarrollo y Paz de Córdoba, Urabá-Darién, y Cámara de Comercio de Bucaramanga.
- Negotiating a work plan and signing a grant with Corporación Region as the main local partner for the project in Antioquia, which includes activities related to all outcomes.
- Producing and presenting an investigation on womens access to political and electoral financing, including recommendations to authorities and political parties to improve the flow of financial resources for promoting gender parity. The Swedish Ambassador participated in the official presentation of this document on March 30th, 2022, along with members of the National Electoral Council, political parties, and civil society organizations.
- The first meeting between TpCs private sector team and Embassys broader relations team was held on April 1st, 2022, to explore ways in which the project can engage with Swedish enterprises to work on transparency and anticorruption matters
